title.narrative: Preventing violence against women and girls with disabilities in Cambodia: a community mobilization model.

description.narrative: The project’s goal is that women and girls with disabilities (WGWD), including those most marginalised, experience less violence in their families and from caregivers. Women-led disabled people’s organisations (DPOs) and disabled women’s networks will lead primary prevention interventions targeting WGWD, including the most vulnerable. As a result, WGWD will access their right to live free of violence, supported by self-help groups, caregivers, other family members, their communities, and key duty bearers, all of whom will increase their capacity to challenge inequitable social norms that tolerate violence and to more effectively identify and prevent violence against women and girls with disabilities in their communities. Learning will be used to promote the need for, and approaches to, expanding primary prevention of violence against WGWD.
